db:article.db:para: Qt's support for different Linux platforms is extensive and mature.

db:section.db:title: Downloading and Installing Qt
db:section.db:para: There are two ways to install Qt:

db:listitem.db:para: through the Qt Installers - downloads and installs Qt

db:section.db:para: You can download the Qt 5 installers and sources from the Downloads page. For more information, visit the Getting Started with Qt page.

db:section.db:title: Requirements for Development Host
db:section.db:para: The Qt installers for Linux assume that a C++ compiler, debugger, make, and other development tools are provided by the host operating system. In addition, building graphical Qt applications requires OpenGL libraries and headers installed. Most Linux distributions do not install all of these by default, but setting up a development environment is still straightforward.
Use the following commands to install the basic requirements for building Qt applications:

db:section.db:title: Fedora/RHEL/CentOS (yum)
db:section.db:programlisting: sudo yum groupinstall "C Development Tools and Libraries" sudo yum install mesa-libGL-devel

db:section.db:title: Building Qt 5 from Source
db:section.db:para: You can also build Qt 5 from the source package and configure it according to your target platform. The source packages are obtained from http://www.qt.io/download/.
Below, you will find more information about building Qt from source.

db:para.db:link: Qt for Linux/X11 - Building from Source

db:section.db:title: Deployment and Other Issues
db:section.db:para: The pages below covers specific issues and recommendations for creating Linux/X11 applications.

db:section.db:title: Where to Go from Here
db:section.db:para: We invite you to explore the rest of Qt. We prepared overviews which help you decide which APIs to use and our examples demonstrate how to use our API.

db:listitem.db:para: Qt Overviews - list of topics about application development
Examples and Tutorials - code samples and tutorials
Qt Reference Pages - a listing of C++ and QML APIs
Qt X11 Extras - provides additional APIs for X11

db:section.db:para: Qt's vibrant and active community site, http://qt.io houses a wiki, a forum, and additional learning guides and presentations.
